message_1: Suppose you have a substitution cipher where each letter of the alphabet is replaced with another letter. If the letter "A" is replaced with "D", "B" is replaced with "E", "C" is replaced with "F", and so on, what is the ciphertext for the word "CRYPTOGRAPHY"?
message_2:
To find the ciphertext for the word "CRYPTOGRAPHY", we need to replace each letter with the corresponding letter in the substitution cipher. 

C -> F
R -> U
Y -> B
P -> S
T -> W
O -> R
G -> J
A -> D
P -> S
H -> K
Y -> B

So, the ciphertext for the word "CRYPTOGRAPHY" is "FUBSWRJDSKBB".
